item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "When the day shall come that we do part," he said softly, and turned to look at me, "if my last words are not 'I love you'-ye'll ken it was because I didna have time." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I talk to you as I talk to my own soul," he said, turning me to face him. He reached up and cupped my cheek, fingers light on my temple. "And Sassenach," he whispered, "Your face is my heart." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Oh, Claire, ye do break my heart wi' loving you." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "D'ye think I don't know?" he asked softly. "It's me that has the easy part now. For if ye feel for me as I do for you-then I'm asking you to tear out your heart and live without it." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Do ye not understand?"he said, in near desparation. "I would lay the world at your feet, Claire-and I have nothing to give ye!" He honestly thought it mattered." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "You are mine, always, if ye will it or no, if ye want me or nay. Mine, and I willna let ye go" -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "For I had come back, and I dreamed once more in the cool air of the Highlands. And the voice of my dream still echoed through ears and heart, repeated with the sound of Brianna's sleeping breath. "You are mine," it had said. "Mine. And I will not let you go." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I shook so that it was some time before I realized that he was shaking too, and for the same reason. I don't know how long we sat there on the dusty floor, crying in each others arms with the longing of twenty years spilling down our faces." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description:
"A hedgehog? And just how does a hedgehog make love?" he demanded.
No, I thought. I won't. I will not. But I did. "Very carefully," I replied, giggling helplessly. So now we know just how old that one is, I thought. " -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I prayed all the way up that hill yesterday, he said softly. Not for you to stay; I didna think that would be right. I prayed I'd be strong enough to send ye away. He shook his head, still gazing up the hill, a faraway look in his eyes. I said 'Lord, if I've never had courage in my life before, let me have it now. Let me be brave enough not to fall on my knees and beg her to stay.' He pulled his eyes away from the cottage and smiled briefly at me. Hardest thing I ever did, Sassenach." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "The dog would run a few steps toward the house, circle once or twice as though unable to decide what to do next, then run back into the wood, turn, and run again toward the house, all the while whining with agitation, tail low and wavering. "Jesus H. Roosevelt Christ," I said. "Bloody Timmy's in the well!" -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Oh, aye, Sassenach. I am your master . . . and you're mine. Seems I canna possess your soul without losing my own." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "You're tearin' my guts out, Claire." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "No sense of the irony of human experience, that we are the highest form of life on earth, and yet ineffably sad because we know what no other animal knows, that we must die." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "The power of the dead is that we think they see us all the time. The dead have a presence. Is there a level of energy composed solely of the dead? They are also in the ground, of course, asleep and crumbling. Perhaps we are what they dream." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "Facts are lonely things" -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "Before pop art, there was such a thing as bad taste. Now there's kitsch, schlock, camp, and porn." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "I've got death inside me. It's just a question of whether or not I can outlive it." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "History was not a matter of missing minutes on the tape. I did not stand helpless before it. I hewed to the texture of collected knowledge, took faith from the solid and availing stuff of our experience. Even if we believe that history is a workwheel powered by human blood -- read the speeches of Mussolini -- at least we've known the thing together. A single narrative sweep, not ten thousand wisps of disinformation. (82)" -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "When I read obituaries I always note the age of the deceased. Automatically I relate this figure to my own age. Four years to go, I think. Nine more years. Two years and I'm dead. The power of numbers is never more evident than when we use them to speculate on the time of our dying." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "This is the whole point of technology. It creates an appetite for immortality on the one hand. It threatens universal extinction on the other. Technology is lust removed from nature. - Murray (WN 285)" -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Vincent Willem van Gogh
item.description: "I dream my painting and I paint my dream." -- Vincent Willem van Gogh

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Art is the only serious thing in the world. And the artist is the only person who is never serious." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "Art is what you can get away with." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Woogie add a quote by Paul Klee
item.description: "A line is a dot that went for a walk." -- Paul Klee
